title: Academic Research Data Access Request Manager
description: A single-page web app for academic research data managers to manually enter and upload data access requests, generate agreement drafts, and track request statuses with basic dashboards and exportable reports. Ensures compliance tracking, ethical approval summaries, and audit-ready logs with secure file uploads.
inputLabel: Enter or upload data access request details
outputLabel: Request summary, status, and draft data usage agreement
systemPrompt: You are an expert assistant helping academic research data managers handle external data access requests securely and compliantly. Accept input as manual text entry or uploaded request forms. Validate all required fields including requester name, institution, dataset, and submission date. Reject any request with missing or invalid data. Provide a clear, concise summary of the request status, compliance and ethics approval states, and generate a draft data usage agreement tailored to the requester. Include audit log entries for all changes. Enforce strict data privacy and refuse any unauthorized or disallowed data. Output must be plain text, optionally valid JSON if structured-output is enabled. Do not automate legal or ethical decisions; assist only with summarization and document generation. If input is disallowed or incomplete, respond with a clear error message and no partial outputs.

presets.label: Summarize Request Status
presets.prompt: Summarize the current status, compliance, ethics approval, and key metadata of this data access request. Highlight any missing or expiring documents.
presets.hint: Use this to get a clear overview of a request's progress and compliance.

presets.label: Generate Data Usage Agreement Draft
presets.prompt: Generate a customized data usage agreement draft based on the provided requester details and dataset metadata. Include standard compliance clauses.
presets.hint: Use this to create preliminary agreement text for review.

presets.label: Audit Log Entry
presets.prompt: Create a detailed audit log entry for this update, including timestamp, user role, and changes made to the request.
presets.hint: Use this to maintain tamper-proof history of request updates.

presets.label: Compliance and Ethics Check Summary
presets.prompt: Provide a summary of compliance and ethics approval statuses, identifying any pending or expired approvals.
presets.hint: Use this to verify the request meets institutional policies.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured-output is enabled, output JSON with fields: {requestId, status, complianceStatus, ethicsApprovalStatus, dataUsageAgreementText, auditLogEntry, errors?}
clarifyPrompt: Please provide all required request details including requester name, institution, dataset ID, submission date, and any uploaded documents. Specify compliance and ethics approval status if available.
finalizePrompt: Confirm the final summary and draft agreement are accurate and complete. If ready, output the complete request record with audit log and status.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Collaborative Data Access Request Manager

niche.scenario: Managing and tracking multiple external data access requests from collaborators and external researchers for shared datasets in multi-institution projects

idea.problem: Academic research data managers face challenges handling numerous external data access requests, ensuring compliance with institutional policies, ethical approvals, and funder mandates, while tracking request statuses, approvals, and data usage agreements over time. Existing tools do not provide a focused workflow for managing these requests systematically, leading to inefficiencies, compliance risks, and communication bottlenecks.
inputs: External data access request forms (uploaded or manual entry)
outputs: Centralized dashboard of all pending, approved, and denied data access requests
Compliance and ethical approval status summaries per request
Customized data usage agreement drafts for each requester
Automated reminders for document expiry and renewals
Communication briefs and templates for requester interactions
Audit-ready logs of data access and approval history
whyItWins: Fills a unique gap by focusing on the data access request lifecycle management, not just data sharing plans or agreements
Streamlines compliance tracking and document generation, reducing administrative burden
Improves transparency and accountability with audit-ready logs and status dashboards
Supports scalable, repeated use in multi-institutional collaborations with varying data governance requirements
Provides a foundation for integration with institutional identity and ethics review systems in future upgrades

upgradePath.today: A single-page web app to manually enter requests, upload forms, generate agreement drafts, and track statuses with basic dashboards and exportable reports.
upgradePath.in90Days: Add automated email notifications, templated communication workflows, and role-based access controls for collaborators and data custodians.
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop multi-page system with integrations to institutional compliance databases, electronic signature workflows for agreements, real-time audit trails, and analytics on data sharing patterns and compliance risks.

riskNotes: Must ensure strict data privacy and security, especially handling sensitive dataset metadata and personal data of requesters
Avoid automating legal or ethical decisionsâ€”system should assist but not replace human compliance review
Require user authentication and role-based permissions to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive request information
Careful user interface design needed to handle complex compliance requirements without overwhelming users

blueprint.summary: A comprehensive system to manage, track, and streamline external data access requests for academic research datasets across multiple institutions, ensuring compliance with policies, ethical approvals, and funder mandates while providing audit-ready transparency and communication tools.
blueprint.primaryUser: Academic research data managers overseeing multi-institutional data access requests
successMetrics: Reduction in time to process and approve data access requests
Increase in compliance adherence and reduction in compliance-related incidents
User satisfaction scores from data managers and collaborators
Number of requests tracked and managed through the system
Frequency and timeliness of automated reminders and communications

components.name: Dashboard UI
components.responsibility: Provide a centralized interface displaying all data access requests with statuses, summaries of compliance and ethical approvals, and quick access to detailed views and actions.
notes: Must support filtering and sorting by status, institution, dataset, and date
Visual indicators for pending actions and document expiries
Accessible with role-based views for data managers and collaborators

components.name: Request Submission & Management UI
components.responsibility: Allow manual entry or upload of external data access requests, management of request details, document uploads, and communication logs.
notes: Form validation to ensure required compliance and ethics information
Support for uploading multiple document types (approval docs, agreements)
Versioning or history tracking of request updates

components.name: Data Access Request API
components.responsibility: Handle creation, retrieval, update, and deletion of data access requests and their statuses, including compliance and ethics approval tracking.
notes: Enforce role-based access control
Support bulk export for reporting
Include endpoints for status updates and audit logs

components.name: Document Management API
components.responsibility: Manage upload, storage, retrieval, and versioning of compliance documents, ethics approvals, and data usage agreements.
notes: Ensure secure storage with encryption
Support expiry tracking and automated reminders
Integrate with communication templates for document sharing

components.name: Data Access Request Store
components.responsibility: Persist all data access requests, including metadata, statuses, institutional affiliations, compliance and ethics approvals, and audit trails.
notes: Must support indexing by status, institution, dataset, and dates for efficient querying
Store request history and changes for audit purposes

components.name: Document Store
components.responsibility: Persist uploaded documents such as request forms, approval certificates, and data usage agreements securely with version history.
notes: Encrypted storage with access logs
Metadata stored for expiry and renewal tracking

components.name: Automated Reminder Job
components.responsibility: Periodically scan for expiring documents and pending approvals to send automated email reminders and notifications to relevant users.
notes: Configurable reminder schedules
Retry logic for failed email deliveries

components.name: Email Notification Integration
components.responsibility: Interface with external email service providers to send notifications, reminders, and communication templates to requesters and data managers.
notes: Support templated emails with dynamic data
Handle bounce and delivery failure reporting

dataModels.name: DataAccessRequest
dataModels.purpose: Represent an external request for access to a dataset including status, requester info, compliance and ethics approvals, and audit history.

dataModels.name: Document
dataModels.purpose: Store metadata and content references for uploaded documents related to requests including approvals and agreements.

dataModels.name: User
dataModels.purpose: Represent system users including data managers and collaborators with role-based permissions.

pages.title: Data Access Requests Dashboard
pages.purpose: Provide a comprehensive overview of all data access requests with filtering, status summaries, and quick actions.

pages.title: New Data Access Request
pages.purpose: Form page to submit a new data access request manually or via document upload.

pages.title: Request Detail and Management
pages.purpose: View and update details of a specific data access request including status, documents, communication logs, and audit history.

pages.title: User and Role Management
pages.purpose: Manage system users, their roles, and permissions to control access to requests and data.

apiRoutes.purpose: Retrieve list of data access requests with optional filters.
Create a new data access request.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific data access request.
Update status, compliance info, or add communication logs to a data access request.
Upload a document related to a data access request.
Retrieve list of users with roles.

backgroundJobs.name: ExpiryReminderJob
backgroundJobs.purpose: Scan documents for upcoming expiries and send automated reminder emails to responsible users.

backgroundJobs.name: PendingApprovalReminderJob
backgroundJobs.purpose: Identify requests pending compliance or ethics approvals beyond threshold time and notify data managers.

edgeCases: Handling incomplete or invalid request submissions with clear validation feedback
Managing document upload failures or corrupted files with retry and error reporting
Ensuring audit logs are tamper-proof and accurately reflect all changes
Gracefully handling expired or revoked approvals and updating request statuses accordingly
Supporting concurrent updates to requests by multiple users with conflict resolution
Preventing unauthorized access or data leaks through strict role-based access control enforcement
Handling institutional changes such as collaborator affiliation updates or role changes
nonGoals: Automating legal or ethical decision-making processes
Providing a full electronic signature workflow in initial versions (planned for future upgrades)
Integrating directly with external institutional identity or ethics review systems in initial releases
Managing the datasets themselves or data storage/sharing mechanisms
Replacing human compliance review or institutional policy enforcement

dataFlow: User authenticates and accesses UI pages (dashboard, request form, request detail, user management) with role-based views enforced.
Dashboard UI fetches filtered data access requests via GET /api/requests with query parameters for status, institution, and date range.
Request Submission UI sends new request data and uploaded documents to POST /api/requests and POST /api/documents respectively.
Request Detail UI fetches detailed request info via GET /api/requests/:id and allows updates via POST /api/requests/:id including status, compliance, ethics, and communication logs.
User Management UI fetches user list via GET /api/users and allows role updates (future extension).
API routes validate inputs, enforce role-based access control, and interact with Prisma data models (DataAccessRequest, Document, User) for persistence and querying.
Document uploads are stored securely with encryption; metadata including expiry and version tracked in Document model.

Background jobs (ExpiryReminderJob, PendingApprovalReminderJob) query documents and requests via APIs, identify targets for reminders, and send templated emails via integration-email service with retry logic.
Audit logs and communication logs are appended on request updates and stored as JSON fields in DataAccessRequest for tamper-proof tracking.
All user actions and data changes are logged for audit and compliance transparency.
validationRules: DataAccessRequest creation requires non-empty requesterName, requesterInstitution, datasetId, and valid submissionDate.
Status fields must be one of predefined enums (e.g., 'Pending', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Expired').
ComplianceStatus and EthicsApprovalStatus must be valid status strings or null.
Document uploads must include requestId, valid type (e.g., 'approval', 'agreement'), filename, and file content; expiryDate if provided must be a future date.
User email must be valid format and unique; role must be one of predefined roles (e.g., 'data_manager', 'collaborator').
Request updates must validate fields individually; communicationLogEntry must include timestamp, userId, and message.
Filter parameters for GET /api/requests must be validated for allowed values and date ranges.
File uploads must be scanned for corruption and size limits enforced.
Concurrent updates to requests must include optimistic concurrency control (e.g., version or timestamp check).
errorHandling: API routes return 400 Bad Request with detailed validation error messages for invalid inputs.
Unauthorized access attempts return 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden with clear error messages.
Document upload failures return 500 Internal Server Error with retry suggestion; corrupted files rejected with 422 Unprocessable Entity.
Conflict errors on concurrent updates return 409 Conflict with instructions to reload data.
Background jobs log failures and retry sending emails with exponential backoff; persistent failures trigger alerting.
All errors are logged server-side with context for debugging and audit.
UI displays user-friendly error messages and validation feedback inline.
Expired or revoked approvals trigger status updates and user notifications gracefully without system errors.
securityNotes: All API routes require authentication and enforce role-based access control strictly.
Sensitive data including documents are stored encrypted at rest; access is logged.
Audit logs are append-only and protected against tampering.
File uploads are validated and sanitized to prevent injection or malware.
Email integration handles bounce and failure reporting to avoid spam or data leaks.
Session management and token handling follow best practices to prevent unauthorized access.
Data exposure is limited per user role and institution affiliation.
Background jobs run with least privilege principle and secure credentials for email services.

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated data manager user on the dashboard page
acceptanceTests.when: They apply filters by status 'Pending' and institution 'University A'
acceptanceTests.then: The dashboard displays only requests matching those filters with correct statuses and visual indicators

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user on the new request submission page
acceptanceTests.when: They submit a request with all required fields and upload valid documents
acceptanceTests.then: The system creates the request, stores documents securely, and shows confirmation with request ID

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user viewing a specific request detail page
acceptanceTests.when: They update the status to 'Approved' and add a communication log entry
acceptanceTests.then: The request status updates, the communication log is appended, and audit log records the change

acceptanceTests.given: An unauthenticated user attempts to access /dashboard
acceptanceTests.when: They navigate to the dashboard route
acceptanceTests.then: They are redirected to login page with an appropriate message

acceptanceTests.given: A document upload with an expired expiryDate
acceptanceTests.when: The user attempts to upload the document
acceptanceTests.then: The system rejects the upload with validation error indicating expiry date must be in the future

acceptanceTests.when: There are documents expiring within the next 7 days
acceptanceTests.then: Automated reminder emails are sent to responsible users with correct document details

acceptanceTests.given: Two users attempt concurrent updates on the same request
acceptanceTests.when: The second update conflicts with the first
acceptanceTests.then: The system returns a conflict error to the second user and prompts to reload data

acceptanceTests.given: A user with collaborator role accesses the dashboard
acceptanceTests.then: They see only requests they have permission to view, with restricted actions

buildOrder: Define Prisma data models for User, DataAccessRequest, Document with indexes and relations
Implement authentication and role-based access control middleware
Develop API routes for users, requests, and documents with validation and error handling
Create Next.js pages for dashboard, new request form, request detail, and user management with client-side validation
Integrate secure file upload handling and encrypted storage for documents
Implement audit logging and communication log append mechanisms
Develop background jobs for reminders and integrate with email service provider
Add UI features for filtering, sorting, visual indicators, and role-based views
Implement concurrency control and conflict resolution in request updates
Perform end-to-end testing including acceptance tests and edge case validations

prismaModelsToAdd: model User { id String @id @default(uuid()) name String email String @unique role String institution String? lastLogin DateTime? @@index([email, role]) }

model DataAccessRequest { id String @id @default(uuid()) datasetId String requesterName String requesterInstitution String requesterRole String? submissionDate DateTime status String complianceStatus String? ethicsApprovalStatus String? dataUsageAgreementId String? auditLog Json? communicationLogs Json? @@index([status, requesterInstitution, datasetId, submissionDate]) }

model Document { id String @id @default(uuid()) requestId String type String filename String uploadDate DateTime expiryDate DateTime? version Int? storageLocation String @@index([requestId, type, expiryDate]) }

nextPrompts.title: Planner: refine requirements
nextPrompts.purpose: Ask for missing constraints, clarify ambiguous requirements, and gather detailed use cases to improve the product spec.

nextPrompts.title: Architect: finalize pages + data models
nextPrompts.purpose: Design the final set of UI pages, API routes, and database models needed to implement the system.

nextPrompts.title: Builder: generate page stubs
nextPrompts.purpose: Generate scaffold code for the UI pages and API endpoints to accelerate implementation.

nextPrompts.title: Integrator: wire pages -> API -> DB
nextPrompts.purpose: Implement the data flow connecting UI pages to API endpoints and database models, ensuring validation, security, and error handling.
